Title: If the AI bubble bursts, which companies actually survive â€” like Amazon did after the dot-com crash?

Content: The AI boom feels a lot like the late â€™90s internet frenzy â€” huge innovation, but insane hype. When this bubble pops, 90% of tools and startups will vanish.

But some players are *too foundational to die*. My shortlist of survivors:
**OpenAI, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Google, Amazon, Hugging Face, Anthropic, Databricks, Mistral/Cohere, and Pinecone.**

These are either infrastructure (compute, data, models) or so deeply integrated into daily workflows that theyâ€™re basically utility layers.

What do you think? Which AI companies have *real staying power* â€” and which ones are just riding the wave?
